name: ELIS WINE BAR & RESTAURANT
address: 1012 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA

reviews.text:
The kind of atmosphere one would imagine in a Nyc wine bar, restaurant. Has a classic euro touch feel. Attracts an eclectic patronage. Drinks and food are top notch. Keep in mind at a cost. A tad bit high for the quality, but you do get quality in return.

A perfect place for a get to know me convo, or catch up with a few friends. Quiet, laid back vibe.

The owner and bartenders are very attentive and friendly. So service is a highlight.

Interestingly, they project old Charlie Chaplin movies on screen by the bar area. Enjoy watching from time to time.

There aren't a lot of choices for spots like this on the UWS region. The ones that are around tend to force a brisk walk.

So if nearby, its worth dropping by. If you live close then definitely stop by.

Very nice cozy place for wine and food. I really enjoyed this wine bar while I had a couple of glasses of wine and some food at the bar. The beet salad and tuna tartare were delicious. So was the Nero D'Avola I drank, a perfect red wine for a chilly evening. I appreciate the welcoming and friendly bar service. I am definitely going back to Elis Wine Bar solo or with friends!
The food is fresh and flavorful, with every dish perfectly seasoned and beautifully presented. The atmosphere is relaxed yet elegant, and the staff is attentive and welcoming.
Great portions, selection,wine list and staff. The Dover sole was absolutely amazing. The live music added a unique and dynamic sound to the evening.  We had to get up and dance!

such a gem! The atmosphere is inviting and perfect for a casual glass or a fun weekend with the Gypsy Kings. The owners Elis and Artur are not only super nice but genuinely care about their customers. They always makes sure everyone feels welcome and taken care of. Plus, they are pretty cute, which doesnâ€™t hurt the vibe ğŸ˜„. Great wine selection, chill music, and an overall amazing vibe. Definitely one of my favorite spots!
amazing food amazing hospitality, a hidden gem on the UWS. love the ambiance and always have the best time here
Great restaurant, owners are amazing, food is unbelievably delicious. 1000000/10 restaurant!!!!!
A nice little gem of a place. Personally love the crab cakes and high recommend. The atmosphere is lovely and I had lovely service.
horrible food poisoning.

Unfortunately the food is really of low quality. Even the fries were completely soaked in oil and not crispy. Service was OK, not that friendly, but efficient. Ambiente was beautiful.
came for the happy hour oysters and it did not disappoint!
The food is excellent, the atmosphere is so cozy and the best part of this restaurant are the owners. They are very welcoming and funny :) their costumer service is 10/10.
Great atmosphere, amazing dishes will definitely come back

the best service i ever did have! everyone here is so nice and very accommodating they really care about their customers. epic wine menu. and all the food is SO great. also a great vibe - you can sit in or outside and they are playing some fun old movies. so perfect ğŸ’¯

Had a midsized party here and boy did it not disappoint. The bar is perfectly situated around the entire space so it is easy to get a drink. The owners are super nice and made it easy to want to go back!

Underwhelming. We wait 26 min for a octopus, when arrived couldn't be further from the one advertised (undercooked,  watery, and so small). The service was lacking of everything, beyond not checking once, the server didn't do the basic, as we order octopus and a dessert  to come at the same: put a spoon on table. Of course after waiting 26 minutes, asking for a spoon result to additional wait, so I had to go get one by myself at the bar. Rush eating to be on time at our show.

Amazing food, music and staff.

The staff was very welcoming and nice. We went in on a Friday and there was some live music playing which added to the experience. The food was delicous.
Amazing food! The filet mignon (medium rare) was cooked perfectly, the lamb chop sliders were packed with flavor, and the tuna tartare was fresh and delicious. Canâ€™t wait to come back!
Amazing service, Elis is the best! Definitely recommend.

Came for the happy hour, 4-6pm every day, enjoyed their $1 oysters with a glass of Vermentino. Divine. Perfect spot for a date night or a chill evening with friends and family! Plenty of outside seating options!
Dollar oyster happy hour was cute! Food poisoning was not ğŸ™ƒ Beware!!!

Elis ranks highest on my list of favorite restaurants. The service is characterized by warmth and hospitality, creating a familial atmosphere. The cuisine is superb. The staff show a keen commitment to ensuring customer satisfaction.
I just stumbled upon the most incredible wine bar!!! Their small plates were off the scale! And the wineâ€¦ wow!! I had the French merlot.

I stopped by while on vacation from Italy and I couldnâ€™t have picked a better spot for dinner. The food was full of flavor and perfectly cooked, the staff couldnâ€™t have been nicer, and the drinks were fantastic. Such a cozy vibe that made me feel right at home, even in the middle of New York.

I had my sisters bridal shower here and had the most amazing time. The owner Elis is truly amazing and cares so much about his customers. The bartender Chris outdid himself in every aspect. Would recommend to anyone and everyone trying to plan an event or simply just have a delicious meal!! 10000/5 stars all around.

One of my favorite spots on the UWS! The owner, Elis, who also frequents behind the bar, is very attentive and knowledgeable, and always greets us with a hug! The food and wine are consistently delicious (we love the mushroom pie, the branzino, and the double brisket burger!) and the vibes are always exactly what weâ€™re looking for - buzzing, but not too loud or overwhelming. Live music on weekend evenings with dancing and fun, followed by a huge napkin toss that always makes us laugh. Excellent neighborhood spot!

Elis is truly one of the best restaurants in the neighborhood.  Vibe and music are always on point, staff is attentive and friendly, while also not ever rushing. Elis and Artur always have a warm welcome and a smile.  Aside from all of this, the food is consistently delicious, always fresh, fabulous presentation.  Their cocktails are so fun, and their wine list is unmatched (personally Iâ€™m a fan of the Riesling ğŸ˜‰).  This is a forever favorite!
Aperitivo fire

2 witte wijn riesling besteld & mix bord.
Wijn was zeker geen riesling en warm.
Mix bord was zielig en smaakloos.
EXCELLENT Wine Bar on Upper West Side. Great bites, outstanding wine list, excellent service

I love this happy hour!! $1 oysters and delicious wine, canâ€™t go wrong. Iâ€™ve also had the Cacio e Pepe which was very good. I like the staff here, and the open air concept makes it such a beautiful experience sitting here in the summer.
As a wine bar, itâ€™s a good vibe and ambiance. Service was a bit sparse and the food was ok. Fries were limp, seafood was ok.
This place is so amazing .. the food was so good. It was my first time here and I will be coming back often.
Such a fun place with amazing food and great service! A must try! Go when the Gypsy Kings are performing for an extra treat!!
Had a lovely date night here. The service was as good as it gets. Felt at home here. The food was excellent. Glad we found this spot.
Itâ€™s a beautifully curated spot with delicious food for every palate. A definite repeat.
Oh my god, this place is amazing food is incredible l love the atmosphere staff is very friendly l love the Oysters tuna steak mushroom pay.

The drinks were fantastic â€” strong, well-balanced, and beautifully presented.As for the food, every dish we ordered was fresh, flavorful, and clearly made with care. The menu had a great variety of options, from small plates to full entrÃ©es. Definitely a place Iâ€™ll be coming back to. Highly recommend if youâ€™re looking for a fun night out with great food and drinks!

Great place to visit. Very intimate and the ambiance is amazing as well. The owners Arthur and Ellis are also very friendly people.

Will visit again

Wow! What a discovery! Beyond our expectations! Please try the Branzino Filet which will blow your mind! If you want to continue getting surprised, try the amazing lamb chops, sako tuna tartar, the angus steak and donâ€™t stop there, so many more we got to try by doing a degustation group menu which finished with a surprising sweet touch!
Looking forward to come here soon and get spoiled by this amazing team! Thank you!

I was so happy to find this treat of a restaurant. We sat on the patio on a summer evening drinking nice wine and a selection of dishes chosen by the owner Elis. The lamb and Branzino were especially memorable.
And to finish it off we were treated to the panna cotta, which I would recommend. Looking forward to coming back!
Fantastic food and wine. Elis is a fantastic host and the staff was diligent and friendly.

ê°€ë²¼ìš´ ì•ˆì£¼ì™€ í•¨ê»˜ ì™€ì¸ì„ ì¦ê¸°ê¸°ì— ì•„ì£¼ ì¢‹ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ë‹¤ì–‘í•œ ì™€ì¸ê³¼ ì£¼ë¥˜ê°€ êµ¬ë¹„ë˜ì–´ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ë˜í•œ ë¶„ìœ„ê¸°ë„ ë„ˆë¬´ ë¶ë¹„ê±°ë‚˜ ì‹œë„ëŸ½ì§€ì•Šì•„ì„œ í¸ì•ˆí•˜ê²Œ ëŒ€í™”ë¥¼ í•˜ë©° ì¦ê¸°ê¸°ì— ì í•©í•œ ê³³ì…ë‹ˆë‹¤.
Bang bang man. Bang bang.
Eliâ€™s Wine Bar is amazing! The food, the service, and Elis himself. Would recommend for anyone in the area!

Amazing food...the best squid, cooked to perfection. The panacotta....I can't event. The flavour is incredible.
The servers were amazing and super sweet.
The wine...Souve,  great dry white wine, went down a treat.
Cannot wait to come back here again.

We visited Elis Wine Bar & Restaurant during happy hour and, unfortunately, it didnâ€™t quite meet our expectations. The oysters were not well-prepared. The calamari and truffle fries were average, and both the pasta and chicken were just okay â€” Iâ€™d rate them a 5/10.

However, the desserts were a highlight â€” moist, flavorful, and clearly the best part of the meal. Iâ€™m hoping that the non-happy hour offerings are more impressive, so I might consider giving them another try. Fingers crossed for a better experience next time.
Loved everything about it. Service was one of the best Iâ€™ve ever experienced. Food was cooked perfectly. Unreal tiramisu. Shoutout Eli

It is chic, warm and inviting. The bathrooms are clean and spacious. My favorite item on the menu is the cacio e Pepe, and the portions are perfect! I like the Radeberger on draft. The owner (Elis) is charming, kind and a professional. Heâ€™s created a space that is truly a part of the community. This is definitely me and my partners favorite date spot! Once or twice a month they even have live flamenco musicians!

Our experience here was so-so. It has a lot of charm and the service was overall just fine, but sadly the food left a bit to be desired. Fries with my burger were soggy, and my dateâ€™s Bolognese was one of the most bland dishes I think I have ever been served in NYC. The drinks were just okay too, nothing to write home about.

The appetizers were good. Beet salad and a side of brussel sprouts.

Maybe we came at an off time, we probably wonâ€™t come back but you never know.

Also one note, these prices are curiously high! There was a glass of wine on the menu that was $22, and we googled the wine and it was $37 a bottle? We eat out enough to know if youâ€™re charging $22 a glass that better be a $60-$70 bottle retail! Câ€™mon youâ€™re only supposed to rip us off a little bit when it comes to drink prices ğŸ˜‰

Dinner experience was exceptional. The service was laid back. It's not intense, but yet. Got you what you wanted when you wanted it.

Special appetizers were fantastic. However, I had the lamb sliders and it just wasn't on the mark. Not bad, but not over the top fantastic

A friend of mine took me here as it was close to his home. I was not expecting much but wow - the owner was ever present and VERY hospitable and just brilliant. The food and the wine was AMAZING! My friend had the lamb chops which he has on every visit here and I ahd the steak which was perfectly cooked - next visit to New York I will definitely go again!!!

Visited this wine bar last night and was blown away by the food! I had the steak, which was cooked to perfectionâ€”juicy and full of flavorâ€”and the black pasta with lobster, which was a total standout with its rich taste and tender lobster. Paired it with a wine suggested by the staff, and it tied everything together beautifully. The vibe was warm and stylish, and the service was top-notch. Already looking forward to my next visit!

My friend and I dined here and ordered oysters, pasta, and calamari. The next day, we both started experiencing the same symptomsâ€”first diarrhea, then nausea (but unable to vomit), followed by dizziness and fever. My friend went to the ER yesterday and was told it was likely due to something we ate, possibly a norovirus infection. I am still currently running a fever.

Right now, I donâ€™t have the energy to take further action, but after I recover, I will seriously consider reporting this restaurant to the health department or seeking compensation. This level of negligence is unacceptable, and I hope others will be cautious before dining here.

My boyfriend and I saw the $1 oyster special from 4-6pm and we were in. It did not disappoint. They were fresh, briny, and perfectly shucked. The table next to us appeared to do the same, ordering a dozen oysters each. We had a total of 3 dozen oysters and tbh could have had more.

The owner stopped by our table and he clearly has a deep passion for hospitality,

5/5 starsâ€”highly recommend.

From appetizers to desserts, this restaurant exceeded all our expectations! Mr. Elis, the owner is very accommodating. I love the ceviche we had for appetizer and lobster black inked fettuccine for an entree. I highly recommend this place.

My wife and I hosted our small wedding reception (for about 70 people) at Elis Wine Bar, and we could not have been happier. From our first dinner in getting to know Artur and Elis, we felt completely taken care of. The atmosphere was perfect and the food was raved about by our friends and family. Whether you're looking for a cozy night out with a great dinner and bottle of wine, or like us, are looking for a place to host your event, we highly recommend this gem!

I came here for the first time with my parents tonight. We sat outside and the whole atmosphere was lovely and the food was great. We ordered wine along with the mushroom bruschetta and crispy artichokes to start, which were delicious, and the mains were excellent as well! The staff were really friendly, and while we waited for our desert they brought us a round of limoncellos :) Had the tiramisu and Nutella crepe for desert, which were great. We will definitely come back soon.

Like others,  I'm ambivalent about posting bcz I selfishly don't want Eli's to get too popular for easy seating,  but it's our neighborhood favorite.   The dollar oysters for happy hour are my passion; the fried baby artichokes, with their sauce are crisp and soft.  The owner is a lovely man, overseeing everything with grace and efficiency.   The motto os, Love is the way," and it comes true here.

Love everything about this neighborhood gem that is so wonderful on so many levels that I selfishly, donâ€™t want word to get out and ruin it. The fact if the matter is that if you love well-made cocktails by someone who actually cares about your weird preference on a traditional drink (ie, non-shaming you), and if you love oysters, Italian cheeses, olives, toasted-to-perfection fresh bread, and so, so much moreâ€”on top of a stylish ambiance that doesn't venture into pretentiousnessâ€”then Elis and his unicorn of a wine bar (plus proper bar & full-menu dinner!) is for you. The first time I popped in, they were still serving what are truly epic happy hour specials. As in seriously, where in all of Manhattan can you find $1 oysters that not only don't haunt your dreams, but instead, make you want to slap yourself for accepting anything less? As featured below plus a my-tini served to perfection ğŸ¸
Great service. Awesome drinks. My pasta was so so. Everything else was delicious. I would definitely recommend for low key night to grab dinner with a friend, lover or alone. Would come back.
Food was incredible - every bite was amazing. Elis was so welcoming and made sure we had a great time the whole night. The place is so cute and I would highly recommend it to anyone!!

First time there with friends and absolutely loved the atmosphere! The service was great. They have live music 2 times/month and was excellent! They encouraged ppl to dance and we had a blast! Food was mediocre though and didnâ€™t live up to my expectations. I will come back next time for drink and appetizers only

Nice ambiance but the portions for their happy hour are the smallest Iâ€™ve ever seen in NYC. This wouldnâ€™t be an issue if they were cheaper but it was still expensive and more of a one-person small dish than something you could equitably share with a date. Bummer, so many great reviews but will not coming back here - even if it is relatively close to where I live.
Insane food!!!! The octopus is so incredibly tender and delicious. Staff is ridiculously friendly. Definitely stop here!!
My family loves this place! The food and service are excellent. The owner/manager is very nice and personable.
